definitions.definition: A period of something, usually painful or unpleasant.
An assault (a fencing encounter) at which the score is kept.
A bulge or widening in a musical instrument, such as either of the two characteristic bulges of a guitar.
The going and returning of a plough, or other implement used to mark the ground and create a headland, across a field.
In a circle around; all round; on every side of; on the outside of.
definitions.example: The snake was coiled about his ankle.

definitions.definition: Over or upon different parts of; through or over in various directions; here and there in; to and fro in; throughout.
definitions.example: He was well known about town.

definitions.definition: Indicates that something will happen very soon; indicates a plan or intention to do something.
Concerning; with regard to; on account of; on the subject of; to affect.
definitions.example: He talked a lot about his childhood.

definitions.definition: Concerned with; engaged in; intent on.
Within or in the immediate neighborhood of; in contiguity or proximity to; near, as to place.
definitions.example: I can't find my reading glasses, but they must be somewhere about the house.

definitions.definition: On one's person; nearby the person.
definitions.example: I had no weapon about me but a stick.

definitions.definition: In or near, as in mental faculties or in the possession of; under the control of; at one's command; in one's makeup.
definitions.example: He has his wits about him.
